name: Rich and Creamy Croques Madames
description: A good croque is all about nailing texture, bread-to-filling ratio, and the goo factor. This recipe, which calls for thin slices of toasted-on-all-sides bread, melted cheese, rich Mornay sauce, and Dijon mustard, is a case study in getting it right—and the fried egg on top is just the icing on the...sandwich.
recipeIngredient: 1 recipe (4 sandwiches) Cheesy, Gooey Croques Monsieurs, hot from the oven

recipeInstructions.text: In a large cast iron or nonstick skillet, heat butter over medium heat until melted. Add eggs and cook until whites are mostly set, about 3 minutes. Cover and cook until whites are set on top, about 1 minute; be careful not to keep covered too long, or top of yolk will begin to cook. Season with salt.
Transfer 1 egg to top of each sandwich and serve right away.
